main event: Two globular dark blue objects appearing six inches in diameter, with gray centers, were observed in trail at estimated 500 MPH over northwest Chicago.
interesting points: The objects were observed moving in trail from southwest to northeast, with the second object passing the first on the left before disappearing.
The observer was emphatic that the objects were not conventional aircraft and provided specific details about their speed, maneuvers, size, and distance.
The observer wrote down his observations, including weather conditions, which exactly matched the weather forecast for the time of the sighting.
The observer had experience in judging the altitudes and speeds of aircraft.
No photographs were known to have been taken, and no intercept action was taken.
sighted object: two globular dark blue objects with gray centers
